item.title: Is Twitter Really 75 Years Old?
item.description: You might be amazed to discover that the core concept of Twitter predates you, your parents, and possibly even your grandparents. While Twitter itself wasn’t around back then, a similar idea existed. In 1935, London had the “Notificator,” a robot messenger described by BoingBoing. This public vending machine allowed people to leave notes for friends. Users could write messages on a continuous paper strip, insert a coin, and their message would move up, making room for the next one.
